result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Lee Peterson in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 7 open cases, 4 cases SAR unassigned. Resolution covers all cases. DA revised offer to settle spells out agreement, also agreement on the SAR cases 4 sentencing parties joint rec 1yr jail on each case, misd repeater, fin obligations converted to civil judgment and continue 328 days credit on each. Pending cases as set forth in revised offer to settle attached to plea questionaire, needs to waive prelim in16CF316 , stip to rest $6994.38, joint rec 16CF269 6yrs prison, 3 in 3 es 16cf316 11yrs 6 in 5 es, concurrently ES cond rest, aoda, no mas, not present, ua, cog, nodru, nc victims listed on rest summary 16cf316 $10 fine plus costs, dna, DRI counts admits to all and agrees that ct can consider for sentencing. Def/Atty agrees.State has complied with victim right files vic statements. 
Waives right to prelim in 16CF316. Ct finds prob cause case bound over. DA information has already been provided to def, will file now. Ct comments Information already filed in January, waiver at that time. State will not be filing, accidentally filed Information in 16Cf269 asks court to disregard information in that case. DA correction, needed to be a waiver in 296 not 316. Ct addresses def 16CF296, ct finds prob cause to bind over. DA gave Atty Perrine Information, efiled information downloaded. Def recieved information, waives reading. Plea questionaire filed. Charges and penalties read 4ct burglary, 4cts bj, para, understands. No gun no vote.  Ct satisfied knowing/vol waiving rights. Def stipulates to factual basis. 
16CF316 plead NC to 1,3,9,11, bail jumping 2,8,10,13. Found guilty other counts DRI, does stipulate to committing those.
16CF296 plead NC 1 and 4, found guilty, admits committed the other offenses, DRI
State comments on sentencing, prior convictions, victim rights complied with. Atty Perrine comments 326 days cts, balance of 57 days applied to felony prison cases, asks court to dri other files, concurs with recommendations.
12CM224,330,13CM174,79 1yr ACJ credit 326 cts concurrent, fin obl continue and civil judgment tax intercept collection
16CF296 and 316 Ct comments believes agreement appropriate.
16CF296 6yrs 3yrs in 3yrs ES consecutive to the SAR cases
16CF316 11yrs 6yr in 5 ES consecutive to SAR cases concurrent to 16CF296 balance of credit applied
ES $6994.38 REST, AODA, NO MAS, NOT PRESENT, UA, COG, COUNS, NODRU, NC VIC, $10 FINE PLUS COSTS, DNA. Not el for bootcamp, is el for sub abuse program. Each count concurrent in cases. Bond applied to restitution first. No gun no vote.
Offer to Settle

Cases 16Ct18,16Cm151,136,16CF214,293,316. Attorney Mark L Perrine in court.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pending cases and SAR cases. Parties asks for another stc  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2017 at 08:05 am.
